qas.question: How many people live in the capitol of Liberia?

What percentage of Liberians live in poverty?

context: Longstanding political tensions from the <a0_0><b5_0>27<b5_0/> year<a0_0/> rule of William Tubman resulted in a military coup in <a1_0>1980<a1_0/> that overthrew the leadership soon after his death, marking the beginning of political instability. Five years of military rule by the People's Redemption Council and <a2_0><a3_0>five years<a3_0/><a2_0/> of civilian rule by the <b8_0>National Democratic Party of Liberia<b8_0/> were followed by the First and Second Liberian Civil Wars. These resulted in <a4_0>the deaths and displacement of <b6_0>more than half a million people<b6_0/> and devastated Liberia's economy.<a4_0/> A peace agreement in <b7_0>2003<b7_0/> led to democratic elections in 2005. Recovery proceeds but about <b9_0>85%<b9_0/> of the population live below the international poverty line.
